controllers.smc.core.gain_validation¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\core\gain_validation.py

Module Overview¶

Gain Validation for SMC Controllers.

Provides centralized validation logic for SMC controller parameters. Ensures gains satisfy stability requirements from sliding mode theory.

Mathematical Requirements:

  • Surface gains (k1, k2, λ1, λ2) must be positive for Hurwitz stability

  • Switching gains (K) must be positive to guarantee reaching condition

  • Derivative gains (kd) must be non-negative for damping

  • Adaptation gains must satisfy boundedness conditions

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#==================== src/controllers/smc/core/gain_validation.py =====================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Gain Validation for SMC Controllers.
  7
  8Provides centralized validation logic for SMC controller parameters.
  9Ensures gains satisfy stability requirements from sliding mode theory.
 10
 11Mathematical Requirements:
 12- Surface gains (k1, k2, λ1, λ2) must be positive for Hurwitz stability
 13- Switching gains (K) must be positive to guarantee reaching condition
 14- Derivative gains (kd) must be non-negative for damping
 15- Adaptation gains must satisfy boundedness conditions
 16"""
 17
 18from typing import List, Union, Dict, Optional, Sequence
 19import numpy as np
 20from dataclasses import dataclass
 21from enum import Enum
 22
 23
 24class SMCControllerType(Enum):
 25    """SMC controller types with different gain requirements."""
 26    CLASSICAL = "classical"
 27    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive"
 28    SUPER_TWISTING = "super_twisting"
 29    HYBRID = "hybrid"
 30
 31
 32@dataclass
 33class GainBounds:
 34    """Bounds for SMC controller gains."""
 35    min_value: float
 36    max_value: float
 37    name: str
 38    description: str
 39
 40    def validate(self, value: float) -> bool:
 41        """Check if value is within bounds."""
 42        return self.min_value <= value <= self.max_value
 43
 44
 45class SMCGainValidator:
 46    """
 47    Centralized gain validation for all SMC controller types.
 48
 49    Provides type-specific validation rules based on SMC theory requirements.
 50    """
 51
 52    def __init__(self):
 53        """Initialize gain validator with standard bounds."""
 54        self._gain_bounds = self._initialize_standard_bounds()
 55
 56    def _initialize_standard_bounds(self) -> Dict[SMCControllerType, List[GainBounds]]:
 57        """Initialize standard gain bounds for each controller type."""
 58        return {
 59            SMCControllerType.CLASSICAL: [
 60                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 61                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 62                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 63                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 64                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "K", "Switching gain"),
 65                GainBounds(0.0, 1000.0, "kd", "Derivative gain (non-negative)"),
 66            ],
 67            SMCControllerType.ADAPTIVE: [
 68                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 69                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 70                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 71                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 72                GainBounds(0.01, 10.0, "gamma", "Adaptation rate"),
 73            ],
 74            SMCControllerType.SUPER_TWISTING: [
 75                GainBounds(1.0, 1000.0, "K1", "First twisting gain"),
 76                GainBounds(1.0, 1000.0, "K2", "Second twisting gain"),
 77                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 78                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 79                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 80                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 81            ],
 82            SMCControllerType.HYBRID: [
 83                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "c1", "First surface coefficient"),
 84                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lambda1", "First surface slope"),
 85                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "c2", "Second surface coefficient"),
 86                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lambda2", "Second surface slope"),
 87            ]
 88        }
 89
 90    def validate_gains(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 91                      controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, any]:
 92        """
 93        Validate gains for specific SMC controller type.
 94
 95        Args:
 96            gains: List or array of gain values
 97            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
 98
 99        Returns:
100            Validation result dictionary
101        """
102        # Normalize controller type
103        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
104            try:
105                controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
106            except ValueError:
107                return {
108                    'valid': False,
109                    'error': f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}"
110                }
111
112        # Get gain bounds for this controller type
113        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
114            return {
115                'valid': False,
116                'error': f"No validation rules for controller type: {controller_type}"
117            }
118
119        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
120        gains_array = np.asarray(gains, dtype=float)
121
122        # Check gain count
123        expected_count = len(bounds_list)
124        if len(gains_array) < expected_count:
125            return {
126                'valid': False,
127                'error': f"{controller_type.value} requires at least {expected_count} gains, got {len(gains_array)}"
128            }
129
130        # Validate each gain
131        violations = []
132        for i, (gain_value, bounds) in enumerate(zip(gains_array, bounds_list)):
133            if not bounds.validate(gain_value):
134                violations.append({
135                    'index': i,
136                    'name': bounds.name,
137                    'value': gain_value,
138                    'bounds': (bounds.min_value, bounds.max_value),
139                    'description': bounds.description
140                })
141
142        # Check for NaN or infinite values
143        if not np.all(np.isfinite(gains_array)):
144            violations.append({
145                'error': 'Gains contain NaN or infinite values',
146                'invalid_indices': np.where(~np.isfinite(gains_array))[0].tolist()
147            })
148
149        # Return validation result
150        return {
151            'valid': len(violations) == 0,
152            'violations': violations,
153            'controller_type': controller_type.value,
154            'gains_checked': len(bounds_list),
155            'gains_provided': len(gains_array)
156        }
157
158    def validate_stability_conditions(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
159                                    controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, any]:
160        """
161        Validate SMC-specific stability conditions.
162
163        Args:
164            gains: Gain values
165            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
166
167        Returns:
168            Stability analysis result
169        """
170        # Normalize controller type
171        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
172            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
173
174        gains_array = np.asarray(gains, dtype=float)
175        stability_issues = []
176
177        if controller_type == SMCControllerType.CLASSICAL:
178            # Classical SMC: surface gains must be positive
179            if len(gains_array) >= 4:
180                surface_gains = gains_array[:4]  # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]
181                if any(g <= 0 for g in surface_gains):
182                    stability_issues.append("Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for Hurwitz stability")
183
184            # Switching gain must be positive
185            if len(gains_array) >= 5 and gains_array[4] <= 0:
186                stability_issues.append("Switching gain K must be positive for reaching condition")
187
188        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.ADAPTIVE:
189            # Adaptive SMC: surface gains and adaptation rate
190            if len(gains_array) >= 4:
191                surface_gains = gains_array[:4]
192                if any(g <= 0 for g in surface_gains):
193                    stability_issues.append("Surface gains must be positive for stability")
194
195            # Adaptation rate bounds
196            if len(gains_array) >= 5:
197                gamma = gains_array[4]
198                if gamma <= 0:
199                    stability_issues.append("Adaptation rate γ must be positive")
200                if gamma > 1.0:
201                    stability_issues.append("Large adaptation rate may cause instability")
202
203        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.SUPER_TWISTING:
204            # Super-twisting: specific gain relationships
205            if len(gains_array) >= 2:
206                K1, K2 = gains_array[0], gains_array[1]
207                if K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
208                    stability_issues.append("Twisting gains K1, K2 must be positive")
209
210                # Super-twisting stability condition: K1 > K2 > 0
211                if K2 >= K1:
212                    stability_issues.append("Super-twisting stability requires K1 > K2 > 0")
213
214        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.HYBRID:
215            # Hybrid controller: all gains positive
216            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array):
217                stability_issues.append("All hybrid controller gains must be positive")
218
219        return {
220            'stable': len(stability_issues) == 0,
221            'issues': stability_issues,
222            'controller_type': controller_type.value
223        }
224
225    def get_recommended_ranges(self, controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, tuple]:
226        """
227        Get recommended gain ranges for controller type.
228
229        Args:
230            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
231
232        Returns:
233            Dictionary mapping gain names to (min, max) ranges
234        """
235        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
236            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
237
238        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
239            return {}
240
241        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
242        return {
243            bounds.name: (bounds.min_value, bounds.max_value)
244            for bounds in bounds_list
245        }
246
247    def update_bounds(self, controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str],
248                     gain_name: str, min_val: float, max_val: float) -> None:
249        """
250        Update gain bounds for specific controller and gain.
251
252        Args:
253            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
254            gain_name: Name of gain to update
255            min_val: Minimum value
256            max_val: Maximum value
257        """
258        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
259            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
260
261        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
262            raise ValueError(f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}")
263
264        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
265        for bounds in bounds_list:
266            if bounds.name == gain_name:
267                bounds.min_value = min_val
268                bounds.max_value = max_val
269                return
270
271        raise ValueError(f"Gain '{gain_name}' not found for controller type {controller_type}")
272
273
274# Convenience functions for direct validation
275def validate_smc_gains(gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
276                      controller_type: str = "classical") -> bool:
277    """
278    Quick validation of SMC gains.
279
280    Args:
281        gains: Gain values
282        controller_type: Type of SMC controller
283
284    Returns:
285        True if gains are valid, False otherwise
286    """
287    validator = SMCGainValidator()
288    result = validator.validate_gains(gains, controller_type)
289    return result['valid']
290
291
292def check_stability_conditions(gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
293                              controller_type: str = "classical") -> bool:
294    """
295    Quick check of SMC stability conditions.
296
297    Args:
298        gains: Gain values
299        controller_type: Type of SMC controller
300
301    Returns:
302        True if stability conditions are satisfied, False otherwise
303    """
304    validator = SMCGainValidator()
305    result = validator.validate_stability_conditions(gains, controller_type)
306    return result['stable']
307
308
309def get_gain_bounds_for_controller(controller_type: str) -> Dict[str, tuple]:
310    """
311    Get gain bounds for specific controller type.
312
313    Args:
314        controller_type: Type of SMC controller
315
316    Returns:
317        Dictionary of gain bounds
318    """
319    validator = SMCGainValidator()
320    return validator.get_recommended_ranges(controller_type)

SMCGainValidator¶

Centralized gain validation for all SMC controller types.

Provides type-specific validation rules based on SMC theory requirements.

Source Code¶

  1class SMCGainValidator:
  2    """
  3    Centralized gain validation for all SMC controller types.
  4
  5    Provides type-specific validation rules based on SMC theory requirements.
  6    """
  7
  8    def __init__(self):
  9        """Initialize gain validator with standard bounds."""
 10        self._gain_bounds = self._initialize_standard_bounds()
 11
 12    def _initialize_standard_bounds(self) -> Dict[SMCControllerType, List[GainBounds]]:
 13        """Initialize standard gain bounds for each controller type."""
 14        return {
 15            SMCControllerType.CLASSICAL: [
 16                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 17                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 18                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 19                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 20                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "K", "Switching gain"),
 21                GainBounds(0.0, 1000.0, "kd", "Derivative gain (non-negative)"),
 22            ],
 23            SMCControllerType.ADAPTIVE: [
 24                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 25                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 26                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 27                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 28                GainBounds(0.01, 10.0, "gamma", "Adaptation rate"),
 29            ],
 30            SMCControllerType.SUPER_TWISTING: [
 31                GainBounds(1.0, 1000.0, "K1", "First twisting gain"),
 32                GainBounds(1.0, 1000.0, "K2", "Second twisting gain"),
 33                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k1", "Joint 1 position gain"),
 34                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "k2", "Joint 2 position gain"),
 35                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam1", "Joint 1 velocity gain"),
 36                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lam2", "Joint 2 velocity gain"),
 37            ],
 38            SMCControllerType.HYBRID: [
 39                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "c1", "First surface coefficient"),
 40                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lambda1", "First surface slope"),
 41                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "c2", "Second surface coefficient"),
 42                GainBounds(0.1, 1000.0, "lambda2", "Second surface slope"),
 43            ]
 44        }
 45
 46    def validate_gains(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 47                      controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, any]:
 48        """
 49        Validate gains for specific SMC controller type.
 50
 51        Args:
 52            gains: List or array of gain values
 53            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
 54
 55        Returns:
 56            Validation result dictionary
 57        """
 58        # Normalize controller type
 59        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
 60            try:
 61                controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
 62            except ValueError:
 63                return {
 64                    'valid': False,
 65                    'error': f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}"
 66                }
 67
 68        # Get gain bounds for this controller type
 69        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
 70            return {
 71                'valid': False,
 72                'error': f"No validation rules for controller type: {controller_type}"
 73            }
 74
 75        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
 76        gains_array = np.asarray(gains, dtype=float)
 77
 78        # Check gain count
 79        expected_count = len(bounds_list)
 80        if len(gains_array) < expected_count:
 81            return {
 82                'valid': False,
 83                'error': f"{controller_type.value} requires at least {expected_count} gains, got {len(gains_array)}"
 84            }
 85
 86        # Validate each gain
 87        violations = []
 88        for i, (gain_value, bounds) in enumerate(zip(gains_array, bounds_list)):
 89            if not bounds.validate(gain_value):
 90                violations.append({
 91                    'index': i,
 92                    'name': bounds.name,
 93                    'value': gain_value,
 94                    'bounds': (bounds.min_value, bounds.max_value),
 95                    'description': bounds.description
 96                })
 97
 98        # Check for NaN or infinite values
 99        if not np.all(np.isfinite(gains_array)):
100            violations.append({
101                'error': 'Gains contain NaN or infinite values',
102                'invalid_indices': np.where(~np.isfinite(gains_array))[0].tolist()
103            })
104
105        # Return validation result
106        return {
107            'valid': len(violations) == 0,
108            'violations': violations,
109            'controller_type': controller_type.value,
110            'gains_checked': len(bounds_list),
111            'gains_provided': len(gains_array)
112        }
113
114    def validate_stability_conditions(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
115                                    controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, any]:
116        """
117        Validate SMC-specific stability conditions.
118
119        Args:
120            gains: Gain values
121            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
122
123        Returns:
124            Stability analysis result
125        """
126        # Normalize controller type
127        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
128            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
129
130        gains_array = np.asarray(gains, dtype=float)
131        stability_issues = []
132
133        if controller_type == SMCControllerType.CLASSICAL:
134            # Classical SMC: surface gains must be positive
135            if len(gains_array) >= 4:
136                surface_gains = gains_array[:4]  # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]
137                if any(g <= 0 for g in surface_gains):
138                    stability_issues.append("Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for Hurwitz stability")
139
140            # Switching gain must be positive
141            if len(gains_array) >= 5 and gains_array[4] <= 0:
142                stability_issues.append("Switching gain K must be positive for reaching condition")
143
144        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.ADAPTIVE:
145            # Adaptive SMC: surface gains and adaptation rate
146            if len(gains_array) >= 4:
147                surface_gains = gains_array[:4]
148                if any(g <= 0 for g in surface_gains):
149                    stability_issues.append("Surface gains must be positive for stability")
150
151            # Adaptation rate bounds
152            if len(gains_array) >= 5:
153                gamma = gains_array[4]
154                if gamma <= 0:
155                    stability_issues.append("Adaptation rate γ must be positive")
156                if gamma > 1.0:
157                    stability_issues.append("Large adaptation rate may cause instability")
158
159        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.SUPER_TWISTING:
160            # Super-twisting: specific gain relationships
161            if len(gains_array) >= 2:
162                K1, K2 = gains_array[0], gains_array[1]
163                if K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
164                    stability_issues.append("Twisting gains K1, K2 must be positive")
165
166                # Super-twisting stability condition: K1 > K2 > 0
167                if K2 >= K1:
168                    stability_issues.append("Super-twisting stability requires K1 > K2 > 0")
169
170        elif controller_type == SMCControllerType.HYBRID:
171            # Hybrid controller: all gains positive
172            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array):
173                stability_issues.append("All hybrid controller gains must be positive")
174
175        return {
176            'stable': len(stability_issues) == 0,
177            'issues': stability_issues,
178            'controller_type': controller_type.value
179        }
180
181    def get_recommended_ranges(self, controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str]) -> Dict[str, tuple]:
182        """
183        Get recommended gain ranges for controller type.
184
185        Args:
186            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
187
188        Returns:
189            Dictionary mapping gain names to (min, max) ranges
190        """
191        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
192            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
193
194        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
195            return {}
196
197        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
198        return {
199            bounds.name: (bounds.min_value, bounds.max_value)
200            for bounds in bounds_list
201        }
202
203    def update_bounds(self, controller_type: Union[SMCControllerType, str],
204                     gain_name: str, min_val: float, max_val: float) -> None:
205        """
206        Update gain bounds for specific controller and gain.
207
208        Args:
209            controller_type: Type of SMC controller
210            gain_name: Name of gain to update
211            min_val: Minimum value
212            max_val: Maximum value
213        """
214        if isinstance(controller_type, str):
215            controller_type = SMCControllerType(controller_type.lower())
216
217        if controller_type not in self._gain_bounds:
218            raise ValueError(f"Unknown controller type: {controller_type}")
219
220        bounds_list = self._gain_bounds[controller_type]
221        for bounds in bounds_list:
222            if bounds.name == gain_name:
223                bounds.min_value = min_val
224                bounds.max_value = max_val
225                return
226
227        raise ValueError(f"Gain '{gain_name}' not found for controller type {controller_type}")

Functions¶

validate_smc_gains(gains, controller_type)¶

Quick validation of SMC gains.

Args: gains: Gain values controller_type: Type of SMC controller

Returns: True if gains are valid, False otherwise

Source Code¶

 1def validate_smc_gains(gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 2                      controller_type: str = "classical") -> bool:
 3    """
 4    Quick validation of SMC gains.
 5
 6    Args:
 7        gains: Gain values
 8        controller_type: Type of SMC controller
 9
10    Returns:
11        True if gains are valid, False otherwise
12    """
13    validator = SMCGainValidator()
14    result = validator.validate_gains(gains, controller_type)
15    return result['valid']

check_stability_conditions(gains, controller_type)¶

Quick check of SMC stability conditions.

Args: gains: Gain values controller_type: Type of SMC controller

Returns: True if stability conditions are satisfied, False otherwise

Source Code¶

 1def check_stability_conditions(gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 2                              controller_type: str = "classical") -> bool:
 3    """
 4    Quick check of SMC stability conditions.
 5
 6    Args:
 7        gains: Gain values
 8        controller_type: Type of SMC controller
 9
10    Returns:
11        True if stability conditions are satisfied, False otherwise
12    """
13    validator = SMCGainValidator()
14    result = validator.validate_stability_conditions(gains, controller_type)
15    return result['stable']

 7
 8    Returns:
